entry.title: Final Exam Review
entry.summary: There are some exam review materials on Moodle (a practice exam and solutions). The Wednesday class session will be a time to go over any questions you have.

entry.title: Computability
entry.summary: Read about Computability and the Halting Problem. This is advanced material that will not be tested in this class, but it is worth seeing as the culmination of the language and computation models we have been exploring.

entry.title: Turing Machines
entry.summary: Read about General Grammars and Turing Machines. This is advanced material that will not be tested in this class, but it is worth seeing as the culmination of the language and computation models we have been exploring.

entry.title: Parsing and Pushdown Automata
entry.summary: Read about parsing and pushdown automata, and look at the exercises in those sections.

entry.title: Context-Free Grammars
entry.summary: Read about context-free grammars and BNF rules, and look at the exercises in those sections.

entry.title: State Machines
entry.summary: (Rescheduled from Wednesday, April 22)

entry.title: Sequential Circuits
entry.summary: Read about sequential circuits, and try the exercises in that section.

entry.title: Exam 2
entry.summary: The second exam, over the second five weeks, is today. It will be open-book and -note (includes DyKnow, Moodle, and FoCSipedia). You should receive an email with a link to the exam and further instructions.

entry.title: Exam 2 Review
entry.summary: There are some exam review materials on Moodle (a practice exam and solutions, and a topic list). The Wednesday class session will be a time to go over any questions you have.

entry.title: Nondeterministic Finite-State Automata
entry.summary: Read about nondeterministic finite-state automata and their connection to regular expressions, and try the exercises in those sections.

entry.title: Finite-State Automata
entry.summary: Read about finite-state automata, and try the exercises in that section.

entry.title: Languages
entry.summary: Read about languages and regular expressions (and their applications), and try the exercises in each section.

entry.title: Graph Traversals
entry.summary: Read more about graphs. Watch the accompanying video plus DyKnow. Try the exercises.

entry.title: Graphs
entry.summary: Read about graphs (not yet finished; sorry).

entry.title: Ordered Trees
entry.summary: Read about binary search trees and heaps, and watch the corresponding video (and DyKnow).

entry.title: Class Resumes
entry.summary: Classes will resume in an online format on Monday, March 30. Work on your DPoodle drawings.

entry.title: No Class
entry.summary: There will be no class today: Friday, March 13, 2020.

entry.title: Exam 1 Return
entry.summary: Today we will be going over the first exam.

entry.title: Accumulators
entry.summary: Continue reading about common patterns of writing functional programs: see the Accumulators section.

entry.title: Helper Functions
entry.summary: Continue reading about common patterns of writing functional programs: see the Helper Functions section.

entry.title: Exam 1
entry.summary: The first exam, over the first five weeks, is today. It will be open-book and -note (includes DyKnow, Moodle, and FoCSipedia).

entry.title: Exam 1 Review
entry.summary: There is a practice exam on Moodle. More details to come.

entry.title: MapReduce
entry.summary: No reading for today. We will talk about the map and reduce functions on lists, and how they made Google what it is today.

entry.summary: The first day will just be making introductions and going over the syllabus. There will also be an introduction to ... FoCSipedia!
